function_call.name: classify_risks
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Inaccurate information on masks and virus transmission","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Effectiveness of social media platforms’ efforts to remove misinformation","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Low presence of accurate information in peer-reviewed journals and official institutions websites","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Spread of false information about covid-19 prevention measures","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misleading articles on covid-19 prevention measures","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Resistance to wearing masks due to misinformation","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misleading articles about coronavirus prevention","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Excessive reliance on non-affiliated and non-peer reviewed sources","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Disproportionate sharing of inaccurate information on social media platforms","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Relying on inaccurate or misleading information about contagious diseases","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disagreements and doubts in the classification process","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Comparison of accurate and misleading articles using chi-square test","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Reliance on inaccurate information from social media","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffectiveness of preventive advice in shared articles","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exclusion of relevant prevention information due to keyword selection","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased utilization of urban green spaces during the pandemic","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Traveling long distances to access attractive green spaces","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Public perception shift towards the importance of urban green spaces","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Significant upheavals in residents’ daily lives and mood due to the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Emergence of the ’new norm’ under the threat of covid-19","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Need for changes in urban and green planning after the pandemic","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High frequency of visits to green spaces during pandemic","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of proximity to green spaces as a primary factor in krakow","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Recognition of green spaces as essential infrastructure for well-being","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited or prevented access to green spaces harming the well-being of urban residents","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of proof that green belts can prevent urban sprawl","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduction in visits to green spaces due to mobility restrictions and fear of infection during the pandemic","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lockdown and closure of public green spaces by the polish government in response to the pandemic","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Belief in the necessity of access to green spaces for mental health and well-being during the pandemic","category":"Mental health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Proximity of green spaces to the place of residence affecting frequency and popularity may lead to overcrowding and increased risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Usage of green spaces located in the city centre indicates willingness to cover larger distances, leading to increased movement and potential spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Avoidance of green spaces during different phases of the covid-19 pandemic indicates concerns about disease transmission and may lead to reduced outdoor activity and social isolation.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Visits to green spaces potentially contribute to the spread of contagious diseases like covid-19.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Compliance with governmental mobility restrictions leading to reduced visits to green spaces.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fear of infection leading to reduced visits to green spaces.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of free time as a reason for reduced visits to green spaces.","category":"Behavioral risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Low ratio of urban green space per capita","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decrease in visitors to green spaces during the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Governmental regulation banning the use of green spaces during the pandemic","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spatial analyses based solely on vector data models may limit the understanding of contagious disease spread through other data types such as raster models or network data.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Conducting an online survey may lead to a biased sample composition, potentially skewing the data analysis and conclusions.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Preference for online questionnaires among younger respondents may result in overrepresentation of this age group in the survey data, leading to age bias in the analysis and conclusions.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of questionnaire for data collection during a pandemic","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spatial analysis and gis methods for studying green spaces during a pandemic","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on gis and big data technologies for covid-19 response","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Survey data collection lacking identifying information","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Broad promotion of the survey","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Encouraging the use of private channels for survey participation","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Conducting an online survey due to the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of online surveys for data collection","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
